Maybe you don't have an account?

awards.canvasHint: (To share the image: Right click > Save image)
awards.disclaimer:
A lot of people criticize the game awards, and to be fair they deserve it, so I wanted to offer this tool so that everyone can make their own list.
Because the real GOTY is the one you choose.
Just customize the categories, add games, you can click to select your winner for each categories.
You can click on export at the bottom to get an image of your awards!
awards.subtitle: Create your own awards and share them with your friends or on your social networks.
awards.title: My awards

blog.noResult: No results, please change your filters
blog.title: Blog posts

fetcher.unauthenticated: You're not authenticated. Refresh your page or <signinLink>login again</signinLink>
fetcher.unknown: An unknown error occured. Retry later and contact Lund to warn about the issue

additionalInfo.item1: Each message on the server gives you 50 points (with a one-minute cooldown, of course)
additionalInfo.item2: You are capped at a maximum of 15,000 points.
additionalInfo.item3: There are currently 142 cards available, which gives the following chances:
additionalInfo.item4: To create a golden fusion card, just like for the other cards, you need 5 copies of the basic version to turn it into a golden card
additionalInfo.item5a: {{xp}} x the card's level for basic cards
additionalInfo.item5b: {{xp}} x the card's level for golden cards
additionalInfo.item5c: Cards count once per type, so if you have 14 basic no. 3 cards and 5 golden no. 3 cards, you will only get {{totalXp}}xp ({{basicXP}} + {{goldXP}})
additionalInfo.title: Some important information:

index.cardListLink: The list of cards can be found <lightLink>here</lightLink>

commandTable.buyDescription: Allows you to buy cards with your points ({{points}} points per card). You can buy between 1 and 6 cards.
commandTable.buyExample: will spend {{points}} points and give you 3 random cards
commandTable.cardsDescription: Allows you to list the cards in your inventory (pagination is available via the ‚óÄÔ∏è and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è reactions)
commandTable.dailyDescription: Allows you to draw a card daily for free. The reset is every day at midnight French time
commandTable.dismantleDescription: Allows you to convert a golden card into 4 basic ones
commandTable.dismantleExample: will remove a golden card but give you in return 4 basic cards n¬∞54
commandTable.fusionDescription: Allows you to sacrifice component cards into a fusion card. You can find them in the list available above (the indication is in the top left of the card, and if you click on it, you can see the components). The command brings up a dropdown menu of possible fusions to perform; you just need to choose the card you want to get.
commandTable.giftDescription: Allows you to receive a gift
commandTable.giftExample: will give you a gift such as points, basic or golden cards
commandTable.goldDescription: Transforms 5 basic cards into a golden card of the same type
commandTable.goldExample: transforms 5 basic cards n¬∞20 into a golden card n¬∞20
commandTable.joinDescription: This command is the first you will need to use to start playing. It creates your profile and gives you 8 cards
commandTable.pointsDescription: Allows you to check how many points you have (the in-game currency to buy cards)
commandTable.profileDescription: Allows you to know your level based on the cards you own and see how much xp you need before the next level
commandTable.sellDescription: Allows you to sell cards to earn points. You earn{{basicXP}} x the card level x the number of cards soldfor basic cards and{{goldXP}} x the card level x the number of cards sold for golden cards
commandTable.sellExample: will sell 3 basic cards n¬∞12 and give {{points}} points
commandTable.twitchDescription: Allows you to link your Twitch username to your gacha account for rewards purchased in Madeleine on Twitch (temporarily unavailable). Your Twitch link will appear on your profile
commandTable.twitchExample: will link your Twitch channel to the gacha
commandTable.viewDescription: Allows you to display a card to see its details

index.description1: Behind this scary word that makes you think of all those mobile games that want your wallet, hides a perfectly healthy game here. Indeed, through Discord, you can play this little card collection game without spending a single euro.
index.description2: This game is based on the 'lore' of my YouTube/Twitch channel, my past experience on the internet, or simply fun ideas shared with the community. Some even have their own card! And if you ever want to understand certain cards, their story is explained to you on the 'list' page.

howItWorks.description: On Discord, once you retrieve the associated role in the appropriate channel, a section will appear with various new channels. The one we're interested in is the one named '#commands'. Here is the list of the different available commands:
howItWorks.title: How does it work ?

index.rankListLink: The ranking of the players is <lightLink>here</lightLink>
index.title: Introduction - Gacha

gameModal.gamePlaceholder: Name of the game to search

noMoreResults.text: You've reached the end of the list, go back or do a new search.
noMoreResults.title: Oops, no more results!

gameModal.selectByPlatform: You need to select a game by platform. Click on details button to see the choices
gameModal.title: Select a game

bot.line1: A Discord bot that allows users to access various features, from a small Rock-Paper-Scissors game to creating polls or even querying the site <hltbLink>HowLongToBeat<externalIcon /></hltbLink>.
bot.line2: It also enables users to play the gacha through the commands it makes available.
bot.line3: You can find the code for the site and the bot on <darkLinkGithub>Github<externalIcon /></darkLinkGithub>.
bot.title: MauriceBot

gacha.line1: A card collection game on my Discord. These cards are based on the universe of my channel, related to the games I've played live.
gacha.line2: Unlike mobile gachas that push for microtransactions, here everything is, of course, free.
gacha.line3: You can access it <darkLinkDiscord>here<externalIcon /></darkLinkDiscord> or view the cards & rankings <darkLinkGacha>here</darkLinkGacha>.
gacha.title: Gacha

other.line1: And many other projects are available or in development, including 3D creations, games, and more. They can be seen in the <projectLink>projects</projectLink> section, but you can also find announcements for new projects via <discordLink>Discord<externalIcon /></discordLink>.

website.line1: Designed to host all my projects, this site has gone through several iterations.
website.line2: Initially only presenting the gacha pages, it has evolved to be cleaner in design, but also richer in features and information.
website.line3: You can find the code for the site and the bot on <darkLinkGithub>Github<externalIcon /></darkLinkGithub>.
website.title: Lundprod.com

welcome.item1: I'm Florian, Lund on internet, I'm {{currentAge}}y.o and I'm a developer.
welcome.item2: Here you'll find all my work and useful links to different platforms.
welcome.item3: I have multiple projects, find what you like; Videos, game on Discord, games from gamejam...

3d.description: I started 3D in March 2023 by following courses on <lightLink>GameDev.tv</lightLink> that I got in a Humble Bundle. Here are my various creations, in chronological order.
3d.title: 3D Projects

guessPal.description: You probably know the game <lightLink>"Who's that Pok√©mon?"</lightLink>? Well, it's the same concept but for the Pals of Palworld.
guessPal.hint: You will see the silhouette of a Pal, and you will have to guess which little monster is hiding behind it!
guessPal.title: Guess the Pal!

overview.intro: I have tons of passions, and just as many projects. If I want to do something, I learn what I need. For example, I learned how to do 3D modeling to handle graphic assets on my own, lacking the dexterity or knowledge for drawing.
overview.listText: Here, you will find a list of all my projects:
overview.title: Projects

item1.description: First 3D render following a course to create a low-poly scene to learn the basics of Blender. It was really interesting to do, and I created 2 renders with different atmospheres: One during the day and another at night.
item1.image2: Final render with a nighttime atmosphere
item1.title: Cottage on an Island

item2.description: 3D adaptation based on a drawing by Fakhear (@fakhear on Instagram)
item2.title: Fakhear's Book

item3.description: 3D adaptation based on a drawing by Sconera (@sconera._ on Instagram)
item3.title: Sconera's Room

item4.description: 3D render following a course on character modeling and basic animation. With the walking animation, it reminded me of the 'Wide Putin' meme.
item4.image1: Demo scene of the character in a pose
item4.title: The Big Guy

guessThePal.description: A small game for Palworld fans
guessThePal.title: Guess the Pal

pizzaJam.description: The result of the Gamedev.js Jam 2023
pizzaJam.title: Pizza Jam
